intro: Exacum marojejyense, commonly known as the Marojejy bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a moderate growth habit. Due to its unique appearance and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
